p: On the other hand, wounds treated with turmeric paste did not indicate a significant variation at all with the other groups. However, the results of observations on D 21 demonstrated that wounds treated with marigold leaf paste resulted significantly ( p ≤ 0.001) in a lesser width of the suture area than the other two groups. The morphological parameters’ findings confirmed the complete healing of wounds treated with both the marigold leaves paste and turmeric paste within 21 days of treatment. On the contrary, there were some postoperative complications such as excessive swelling, exudation with a foul odor, and stitch abscess in the control group treated with normal saline until D 21 and later.
